good bouncer, at his body, and Pujara ducks it
slower offcutter, short of a length, and it moves too far down leg. Helped away past midwicket
short of a length, into the pads, there is a square leg to prevent this single
full, outside off, 145ks, defended off the front foot. Lovely spell by Cummins: 6-0-8-1. I doubt he will get another tonight
inside edge has saved him. Nearly there. On a length, outside off, turns back in, is hitting him plumb in front, except for the faint inside edge
flat, short of a length, turned into the helmet of short leg
down the wicket, not to its pitch, plays the defensive shot
flat, quick, Vijay goes back to work this to leg for one
sharp offbreak but short of a length, and Pujara works this past short leg for one
flat, middle and off, angles away, hits the outside half of the bat
on a length, just outside off, Pujara nice and positive in moving forward to defend
full, just outside off, pushed to mid-on
wide length ball, and Pujara leaves it alone
short of a length, outside off, defended to point
length ball outside off, hits the outer half of the bat as Pujara strides forward in defence
short of a length, just outside off, Pujara keeps it out. Four overs to go today
some turn from just outside off. Vijay defends solidly
on a length, just outside off, watchfully played back to Lyon
Cowan for Vijay as he clips a full ball past midwicket for one
presses forward and then goes back to defend a flat delivery
short of a length, on the pads, punched away for a single
tossed up outside off, driven to cover
wide on the crease, on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
straight and on a length, watchfully played to mid-on
wide length ball, and Pujara gets another big stride in to defend
short of a length, into the body, hits the handle of the bat but the ball goes down as opposed to popping up
goes for the bluff with the yorker but ends up bowling a full toss. Pujara is too smart for all those tricks. Clips it away for four through midwicket
and now bowls the short ball. Higher than his chest, just outside off, and he drops his bat and wrists under it
beautiful shot. Languid. Down the wicket, meets this on the half-volley, and push-drives this between the bowler and mid-off

and they review for bat-pad after it has been turned down. This one turns sharply after pitching on off, and there is no disturbance on the snicko when it passes the glove. Hits the pad high, so no chance of lbw either. Technically, the umpire has not followed the protocols. Doesn't check for lbw
flat, on the pads, worked to leg
full, middle and leg, defended to midwicket
full, outside off, pushed for a single wide of mid-off
well done by Smith. Pujara looks to cut a flat ball outside off, gets a good chuck of wood on it, and Smith at slip does well to field this on the half-volley
full, on off, played back to him
slower in the air, defended right back
tossed up again, really slow, Vijay defends this off the front foot
another forward-defensive
flatter, from wider on the crease, defended solidly again
some dip, some turn, Vijay plays this off watchfully to end unbeaten at stumps
on a length, well outside off, slight movement back in, and solidly defended off the front foot
again slight swing back in from well outside off. Watchfully defended again
short of a length, and Pujara immediately opens the face to run this down to third man for a single
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
length ball, swinging in, defended off the back foot
fuller, closer to off, Vijay is caught on the back foot, and the ball swings in to beat him. It also rolls along to the keeper
full, middle and leg, defended to leg
slight drift into middle and leg. Defended back to him
no turn, hits the inner half of the bat as Pujara defends
low full toss on the pads, clipped away for a single to long leg

Vijay surprises everybody but at the same time it is not a surprise because he does this every now and then. Jumps out of the crease, maintains some distance between himself and the ball, and lofts this effortlessly over long-on
O'Keefe stays slow in the air, and Vijay defends this to mid-on
on a length, just outside off, solid forward-defensive
on a length, closer to off, holds its line a little. Defended off the front foot
wide on the crease, draws him into a forward-defensive outside off. Holds its line a little but no threat to the edge
slight movement in, from a length outside off, hits the inner half of the bat
surprise short ball, gets it into his face, Pujara fends with bottom hand off, ans is hit on the top glove. The ball goes down to the vacant backward short leg region. No short leg in place anyway
on a length, outside off, movement back in, and defended watchfully by Vijay
shimmies down, takes this on the full, drives it straight to mid-off
forward-defensive now
less flight this time, Pujara defends in front of his body
quicker, more effort, gets some turn, and hits the outside half of the bat as Pujara defends
quick, no turn, hits the inner half this time. 'He'll run down this ball now,' says Wade
slightly too full and Pujara is able to smother the turn on this full ball. A good over from O'Keefe that kept Pujara honest. The first maiden of the day
short of a length, shaping back in, defended from the crease
fuller, swinging in, clipped away, but Maxwell makes a diving save at short midwicket
short of a length, outside off, bunted into that vacant point region for a single
wide length ball, Pujara doesn't go after it
short ball, just a touch too far down the leg side, and Pujara just sneaks inside its line
on a length, on top of off, pushed to mid-on
on a length, on off, defended back to him
short of a length, Vijay goes back, but the ball stays low. However, it doesn't hurry off the pitch so easy to keep it out
flighted on off, defended back to O'Keefe
pushed to short cover
bounce for O'Keefe from a length just outside off. Hits Vijay on the glove. The lower glove
successive maidens for O'Keefe as he stays in that testing zone on a length around off. Defended back to him
wide length ball, pushed square, but not square enough of square cover
on a length, pretty straight, Pujara can't do much other than give it full face of the bat in defence
fuller, tailing in, pushed to mid-on
on a length, around the fifth stump, Pujara asked to defend again
wide on the crease, angles it too far, clipped away for a single to deep square leg
hit him on the shoulder. Hazlewood bounces him, Vijay looks to get inside its line, but the ball doesn't get up as much as expected, and gets him on the shoulder. No display of pain from Vijay
flat, quick length ball outside off, and left alone
on a length, on off, gets good bounce. Defended back to O'Keefe
fuller, but stays around off. Defended back to him
turn there. Australia will like this. From the good part of the pitch. On a length, fourth-stump line. Beats the forward-defensive
flatter, fuller, pushed to short cover
fires this into the pads, and clipped away for a single
short of a length, no bounce at all, punched away from thigh high, but can't beat short cover
length ball, quick, hits him high on the bat as Pujara defends
full and wide, Pujara is not tempted into the drive
short of a length, outside off, defended to point with an open face
good bouncer, at his head, no room, and Pujara is good enough to duck it without trouble
another short ball. This one doesn't take off. Goes rib high, and Pujara gets inside its line. Another maiden from Australia
Vijay gets to 50 in his 50th Test. A patient innings. A big innings for him and for India. Pushes one slightly to the left of short cover, and sets off for the single
full, drifting in, hits the inside half of the bat as Pujara defends. No turn
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
flatter, from wide on the crease, just outside off, hits him high on the bat as he defends
fuller, drifting in, defended off the inside half of the bat
slightly short, Pujara cuts down on it, but can't beat backward point
short of a length, just outside off, defended by Vijay
on a length, just outside off, defended off the back foot
wide length ball, and he leaves it alone. This one doesn't carry to Wade
short of a length, angling in, defended with an open face
loose shot. Looks to hook from well outside off. Slightly casual too. The ball sneaks under the bottom edge
short of a length, wide outside off. Left alone. Consecutive maidens for Cummins
down the wicket, drives, but off the inside half of the bat
and O'Keefe finally gives them the loose ball. And Pujara is really good, he cashes in on these. Short of a length, straight, and he guides it past midwicket
full again, Pujara defends well in front of his body
tossed up outside off, pushed to short cover
full, no turn, down the leg side, and Wade sticks his leg out to save three byes
flat, on off, on a length, defended solidly
short of a length, outside off, defended from the crease
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot. Half forward to it
tries the really full ball. Pujara drives, but doesn't time it. Hit on the inner half of the bat
slower ball, offcutter, outside off, on a length. Pujara forward but recovers well to defend. Hit high on the bat
short of a length, from wide on the crease, punched to cover-point
bouncer, it stays low, but Pujara ducks it well. Third straight maiden for Cummins
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a couple
what was that? Loose, casual drive to a length ball. The ball hits the inner half of the bat and chips up. The mid-off is back, though. That is 50 for this stand
length ball, quick into his pads, defended, and reaches short leg on the half-volley
forward-defensive
down the leg side again, and this time Wade makes a good collection
turn and bounce there. From just short of a length, just outside off, and Pujara does well to not follow it with his hands
loose again from Vijay. Just a casual drive. Gets an inside edge onto the pad, and it is headed towards slip but hits his armpit and falls down
turn again, and defended to leg
Vijay charges, is not to the pitch of the ball, and kicks this offbreak away
nice quick turning offbreak. Defended off the pad
no backward short leg. Vijay not in control as he works this around the corner. They get a single to short fine
short of a length, middle and leg, played to short leg on the bounce
short of a length, O'Keefe will be disappointed he has allowed them this easy single
nice dip outside off, Pujara defends off the front foot
nice shot. Jumps out of the crease, takes this on the half-volley, drives this wide of mid-on for one
on a length, outside off, defended with hard hands
no turn, but the ball is slow, and Vijay recovers to defend this with the inner half of the bat
drift and no turn. Vijay reacts off the pitch and defends this well
down the wicket, nicely clips this away, but Maxwell saves three runs with a dive at short midwicket
sweeps, but this is too full to sweep, which is what excites Lyon. However, he gets the bat down in time for a single
presses forward and goes back as he sees a flatter trajectory. Punched to mid-off
slight shimmy, Lyon stays flat, defended off the front foot
slower in the air, pretty straight, defended from the crease
nice loop and dip without sacrificing the pace. Pujara has to defend this respectfully
full, outside off, too full, and driven to long-off for one
ordinary delivery, flat and speared into the pads. Tucked away for a single
down the wicket, and pushes one to deep mid-off for a single
on a length, middle and off, no turn, and hits the inside edge on the defence
drift into the pads, some dip too, and again he is hit on the inside half of the bat

big appeal for lbw but the inside edge seems to have saved him. Smith, though, goes for the review. Again a ball with no turn. Pujara has played for turn but has been done in. Smith is gambling on pad first here because bat and pad are too close together. On the Ultra Edge replay there seems to be a bit of a spike before it hits the bat, especially on the side-on view, but the umpire goes by the front-on replay and sees the bat first. It might well be bat first, but the umpire seems to have jumped the gun here

appeal for bat-pad and this is not out. Turns past the inside edge and lobs off the pad alone. Hang on. Clear inside edge there. Australia have no reviews left. India getting the rub of the green here
flatter, no turn, and Vijay defends off the back foot
short of a length, Vijay punches this to midwicket
down the wicket, Lyon bowls one that doesn't turn, and he defends
flat, on a length, defended
forward-defensive to end another maiden
short of a length, punched uppishly to mid-on
short of a length, stays low, punched to mid-on
again, flat and short of a length, Pujar can't get it away, though
this time he finds the gap past point. O'Keefe dropping these short
defended off the front foot
into the pads, worked away to leg
down the wicket to pad one up to short leg. There is an appeal for a catch but there is no bat involved this time
flat, quick, 94ks, defended back to him
worked off the pads for a single
quick, dipping, on off, defended back to him
down the wicket, yorked, pushes this to mid-off for a single. Quick running, good call
on a length, just outside off, no turn, defended back to him
on a length, middle and leg, turns towards off, defended form the crease
full, outside off, driven to mid-off
on a length, angling in, defended to leg
on a length, on off, slight dip, defended back to him
inside half of the bat, defended to leg
quick to rock back and punch a flat delivery to the left of cover-point for one
on a length, on off, inside half of the bat as he defends
full, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
down the wicket, smothers the turn
down the wicket again, clipped straight to short midwicket
flat, outside off, he goes back to punch it, but straight to point
on a length, straight, defended to short leg
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep cover
pads one away outside off
flighted outside off, driven to mid-off
nicely played. Down the wicket to take this on the full, and drives it wide of mid-on for one. Lyon does well there to save three runs on this quick outfield
and Vijay takes the calculated risk. This time the slog sweep. He nails this absolutely. Over midwicket. This should get them some breathing space
flat, short of a length, into the pads, worked to leg for a single
down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, defends to cover
sweeps really fine from outside off. This is a lovely shot. Places this wide of backward short leg and fine of deep fine leg. All along the ground
on a length, on off, defended back to him
another sweep, this time square on the leg side, gets a couple. And all along the ground again
on a length, middle and leg, defended to short leg
down the wicket again, Lyon pulls the length back, and he defends
slower length ball, middle and leg, defended to short midwicket
nice shot. Short of a length, outside off, he steers it fine of square third man for a couple
slower offcutter, on a length, defended back to him
lovely shot. The bottom hand into play. Hazlewood bowls a half-volley, and he has crunched this straight of mid-on for a four all along the ground
offcutter again, and Pujara defends off the front foot
tries to bounce him, the ball stays low and is outside off. Easy to avoid
lovely shot now. Down the wicket, moves away from the line of the ball so he has room to swing his arms, and he lofts this over mid-off
non-turning offbreak. He looks to work this away off the pads, and gets an outside edge to guide this past slip
flighted outside off, and kicked away
down the wicket, defended to leg
dipping on him, middle and off, turning in, defended to short leg
short of a length, pitched outside off, punched to mid-on
gets a single to third man as Hazlewood bowls wide
on a length, on off, holds its line, defended back to him
offcutter, punched to mid-off
short of a length, into the pads, tucked away to deep square leg for one
offcutter, slower, outside off, slightly casual drive, but stays down in front of short cover
short of a length, angling in, defended to mid-on
flat, short of a length, punched into the boot of the silly point. Pujara is lucky it doesn't lob up for a catch
defended to cover
into the pads, worked away for an easy single
on a length, on off, defended from the crease

this is a calculated risk, but Vijay is doing them well. He is hitting into the vacant spaces. Slog sweeps this against the turn and over midwicket. A lot of conviction in the shot once he makes his mind up
flat, on a length, no turn, defended off the back foot
bottom hand takes over again. Hazlewood pitches this too far up, and he drives it straight. Doesn't get all of it, but the quick outfield carries it past the dive from mid-on
wide length ball from wide on the crease. Pujara is not tempted into a shot
shout for a catch at short midwicket. Not given. This is a brute of a short ball, headed for the melon, Pujara throws up his arms to protect his face, and the ball flies off his arm guard
short again, loop bounce now, defended towards slip
slower offcutter, but he is equal to it. The weight still coming forward after that bouncer, and guides this to third man for one

huge huge lbw shout. Wide on the crease, Vijay stuck in the crease to a full ball, oh that looks really close. Not given on the field, and Australia have no reviews left. Ordinary shot from Vijay first. Playing across its line. The ball is really full. Is there enough angle for it to miss the stumps? Yes, missing leg clearly. Well done umpire
sharp turn from short of a length, takes the outside edge and goes past slip
full, outside leg, defended back to him
outside leg and kicked away

oh what has Vijay done here? He jumps out of his crease, in this, the last over before lunch, and misses it. The ball sneaks between his pad and bat. The expected turn doesn't arrive. Wade does well with the collection down the leg side. And he is stumped. He has thrown it away at the stroke of lunch
short of a length, outside leg, punched into the shin of short leg
solid front-foot defensive to end the over
too full, too straight, Pujara lets it swing, and then plays it late. Lovely clip to beat the two men close in on the leg side
short of a length, just outside off, right behind it in defence
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, straight to mid-off
wide on the crease, short of a length, defended off the front foot
nicely clipped away off the pads, but can't beat forward square leg. He does well to keep it down
short of a length, from wide on the crease, defended to short midwicket. Might even have been the offcutter
full, outside leg, driven to mid-off
short of a length, outside leg, worked around the corner for one
on a length, some dip, on off, defended
down the wicket, takes this on the half-volley, drives it to mid-off
flatter, quicker delivery that doesn't turn. Pujara picks it off the pitch and keeps it out
flighted outside off, defended back to him
full, on off, driven on the up. No pain on the shoulder
short of a length, outside off, hits the inside half of the bat
on a length, on off, pushed to mid-on
short of a length, outside off, defended to short midwicket
on a length, outside off, holds its line, defended solidly
forward defensive, nice sound off the middle of the bat. Not too much discomfort shown by Kohli
full, on off, defended back to him
full, from wide on the crease, defended back
nice shot. Pujara knows the field well. At first look you see he has whipped this in the air but there is no man at square leg, and he has punished this error in length as O'Keefe pitches short
full, middle and leg, defended back to him
slight low bounce and no turn. Pujara equal to it. Keeps it out
beautiful shot to bring up his fifty. Down the wicket, right to its pitch, drives it with the turn, all along the ground, between mid-off and cover
the shoulder doesn't look in trouble there. Whippy drive from outside off, past midwicket
offbreak outside off, kicked away by Pujara
on a length, some dip, Pujara right forward in defence
offbreak, outside off, pushed wide of cover for a single
tossed up outside off, right behind him in defence
another whippy drive, past short midwicket, gets a single
tossed up outside leg, padded away
closer to the stumps, defended back to him
short of a length, pitched outside leg, worked past short leg
on a length, on leg, defended back to him
kicked away as this is pitched outside leg
and he pads away another delivery outside leg
good, flat quick ball, looking for the lbw. Kohli keeps it out with the bottom hand coming off
flat again, outside off, pushed wide of mid-off for one
on a length, on leg, turning in, defended past short leg
the flatter shorter ball, doesn't turn, stays a touch low. Pujara keeps it out
short of a length, outside off, pushed wide of cover for one
on a length, middle and off, defended back to him
kicks one away again
Pujara pads away another ball outside leg
slightly shorter, worked around the corner, but straight to short fine leg
pads away another delivery
full, on off, Pujara right forward in defence
tossed up outside off, Pujara pads it away
short of a length, on off, punched to mid-on
length ball, middle and leg, worked to leg
full, middle and leg, whipped away again, gets a single to deep midwicket
down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, and plays it uppishly, forward of short leg
lovely shot again. He is down the wicket, reaches the pitch of the ball, and uses the bottom hand to drive this straight of mid-off. Again, keeps this along the carpet
short of a length, punched to deep midwicket for one
on a length, just outside off, defended to mid-on
full toss. Meat and drink for Pujara. Flicked away off the pads through midwicket. This is yorker gone wrong

lovely shot again. Short of a length, into the pads, tucked away off the hip, between midwicket and square leg. Maxwell gives it a mad chase. Dives in. Just like Kohli. And keeps it in. And his shoulder is fine

Kohli is gone. Sharp catch at second slip. Pin-drop silence in Ranchi. He is walking slowly. They are checking for a no-ball. He is well in. A loose shot. Wide half-volley, no feet, he drives at it, and the edge flies to second slip, who has crept up because of the low bounce. This one flies at him, giving him little reaction time. He leans back, absorbs the momentum of it, and takes it clean as a whistle. How about that Maxwell chase that brought Kohli on strike? Kohli in the field tried to do the same, and injured himself
on a length, angling in, placed square of forward square leg for one
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg
on a length, outside off, holds its line, left alone
big lbw shout but going down. On a length, on off, seams in, goes past inside edge. Quickly turned down
wide length ball, left alone
swing with a really full ball. Hits the thick outside edge and goes along the ground to point
good bouncer. Following him as Rahane sways out of its line. Drops his wrists, though
wide length ball, swinging away, Rahane too pushes with hard hands. He, though, doesn't edge it like Kohli. Short cover fields

just wide of the diving Wade. This is seriously quick and short of a length. Pujara is hurried into the glance, and it goes much finer than he wants it to because of the pace. Wade can't reach it, though
bouncer, on off, Pujara ducks it
fuller, on off, solid front-foot defensive
short of a length, outside off, punched wide of point. The fielder gets a hand on it, but the fast outfield still carries it away for four
goes for the yorker, ends up bowling a half-volley on the pads. Clipped away for one
short of a length, defended to cover. Pujara wants a run but is sent back. Rightly so
on a length, just outside off, holds its line. Defended off the front foot
short of a length, straight, defended back to him
on a length, good bounce, defended off the front foot
on a length, into the pads, clipped away to long leg for one
full, outside off, punched down to mid-off
bouncer, outside off, not much bounce, but easy to avoid because of its line
uncharacteristic loose drive from Pujara. Against the turn and away from his body. The thick outside edge flies past slip
good sharp turn in, Pujara too lets it turn and takes the bottom hand off to keep this down
nice dip, around off, defended off the back foot. He is getting turn now. Can he get one to kick up at him?
down the wicket, hit straight to mid-on, but good calling and they take the single
cat-and-mouse play, and Rahane wins this ball. He jumps out, Lyon drifts one outside off, but his bat catches up with it, and he drives this through extra cover. All along the ground
forward-defensive to end the over
on a length, too straight, Pujara getting loose balls suddenly and he is cashing in. That is Test batting. Blunt them until they bowl loose balls. Gets a couple through midwicket
short of a length, into the pads again, tucked away
tucked away off the hip too. Rahane rides the bounce well, and takes the bottom hand off the bat
nicely played. Punches this wide of cover for one
short of a length, angling in, dabs down on it
good shot. Looks like a pull shot that has gone in the air, but Rahane knows there is no deep square leg in place. Gets four for it. This right here is the partnership
down the wicket, takes it on the full, drives it back to Lyon
short of length, on the pads, worked away for one
on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
goes back to defend a length ball. Does well even as the ball skids
quick, on a length, pitches leg, defended back to him
quick, into the pads, worked away for another single
a shooter. Short of a length, straight, stays low, but Rahane is watching it closely, and turns it away for a single
short of a length, outside off, places this forward of that deep backward point, calls for two immediately, and comes back easily
tucked away off the hip for another single
on a length, and straight, looking for the lbw. Defended watchfully by Rahane
uppishly clipped towards short midwicket. That is slightly loose, but it doesn't carry to that man
nearly played on. Short of a length, outside off, Rahane looks to dab down on it, but the ball jags back in and skids on. Somehow it avoids the stumps after hitting the underside edge
flat, middle and leg, defended to leg. Pujara seems to be wringing his right hand in some discomfort
down the wicket, middle and off, defended back. Wade says, 'Nearly missed on the outside there.'
short of a length, on the pads, worked away for another easy single
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
nice dip, middle and leg, making him defend, which Rahane does well
Rahane sees the flatter trajectory, goes back, lets the ball turn, and works it behind square for one
down the leg side again. Too loose this session. Wade can't get to it, especially because it bounces in front of his dive
full, just outside off, solid front-foot defence from Rahane
pulls this, and keeps it down too, takes a single to long leg
steered away to third man as Cummins gives him the width outside off
on a length, outside off, holds its line, defended back to him
wide length ball, left alone
on a length, on off, kicks at him, hits him high as Pujara defends. Takes the bottom hand off
slight turn now, hits the outside half of the bat as he defends
down the wicket, driven straight to mid-off
down the wicket again, gets a juicy full bunger, and drives it along the ground and between mid-on and midwicket
more easy runs. Australia getting frustrated there. Fires this into the pads, and Wade can't catch up with it
on a length, middle and off, no turn, defended back to him
length ball, outside off, defended solidly. Australia need to do more of this

bouncer it is, and Cummins gets him. Rahane looks to ramp it. This is too high, but the loopy bounce means it is still in Rahane's sight and he looks to ramp it almost as an afterthought. Too high to reach it. Would have been called wide had he not nicked this, but he nicks it. Off his feet as he connects
goes for the yorker, bowls a full toss, defended to cover
full and fast, outside off, 144ks, dug out by Nair
full and fast again, 144ks, just outside off, nicely pushed to mid-off. There is a bouncer coming
short of a length. Not quite the bouncer, but he has hit him in the midriff. Nair beaten by the movement back in after pitching
full, outside off, defended with an open face
full again, Pujara gets the front foot in and defends
wide on the crease, angling in, defended towards mid-on
no turn on this as it is pitched up, hits the inside half of the defensive shot
fires this into the pads. Unable to build an over together against Pujara. Goes for a single
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
wide teasing slower offcutter. Left alone. Pujara not the one to be tempted into driving

the first hundred by an Indian batsman this series. This time he drives at one as Cummins gets closer, and he drives it all along the ground, between mid-off and cover. Removes his helmet, soaks in the applause, and back to work. The dressing room stands up for him
offcutter, gets big on him, hits him high on the bat as he defends
short of a length, just outside off, defended back to him
wide on the crease, angles one in, defended to mid-on
bouncer. At his head. He ducks it. Cummins might be done for this session
loose from Nair. Drives this in the air, past short cover. Gets four but not the ideal shot. Casual
tossed up outside off, left alone
flat, on off, slight turn, uses the pace to get a single past point
long half-volley, on off stump, Pujara's bottom hand takes over and crashes it straight of mid-off for four
short of a length, outside leg, worked around the corner for one
full, on off, defended back to him
length ball, middle and leg, defended
short of a length, Pujara goes back, the ball stays low, and he keeps it out
slows this down, on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
short this time, punched away to deep midwicket for one
on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
short of a length, on off, pushed wide of cover for an easy single
full, Nair looks to turn this to leg, the ball turns and hits the leading edge. Rolls back to the bowler
O'Keefe showing clear signs of fatigue. CDrops another ball short, and Nair goes back to cut it for four
on a length, on off, Nair right forward in defence
tosses one up outside off, defended to cover
full, on off, no turn, hits the inside half of the bat as he defends
wide on the crease, on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
short ball, at the stumps, pulled away to deep square leg for one
on a length, on the pads, another easy single
on a length, outside leg, defended to square leg
slight shimmy, the ball dips, defended to midwicket
fast, outside leg, kicked away
another ball outside leg padded away
length ball, on the pads, defended to leg
full, outside off, opens the face, places this wide of cover for one. That takes India to 300
beaten in the flight when he leaves the crease. Defended to leg
shorter immediately after that previous charge. Pujara takes the single now
short again, Nair makes room, pushes it wide of mid-off for a single
flat, on the pads, he goes back to work this away for a single
on a length, fifth-stump line, defended off the front foot
wide length ball, defended off the front foot
wide length ball, Pujara right forward in defence. What amazing patience and respect for the game. He is 100-plus, but he is still starting a new session as if starting a new innings
wide length ball, slight movement back in, plays with an open face to cover-point
gets a big stride in, and leaves alone a length ball outside off
wide on the crease, slides in a loose ball down the leg side, it flicks something on the way through to Wade, they appeal, the umpire doesn't give it, and they don't review it
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
beautiful bowling but he gets four byes. Tossed up outside off, slower in the air, nice dip, drift, and then turn past the inside edge
reverse sweep. India immediately looking to make sure Lyon doesn't get bowling that length again. Gets two
stays back to defend a length ball
lets this offbreak turn, uses soft hands to work this around the corner for one
down the wicket, gets to the pitch of the ball, clips it to deep midwicket for one
gets extra bounce on the length ball, hits him high on the bat as Pujara defends
on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
on a length, stays low, Pujara defends off the front foot
wide length ball, but Pujara is not being tempted into driving at it
short of a length, outside off, punched back at him
extra bounce on one that is pitched short of a length. Hits him high on the bat
short of a length, and easily pushed to deep point despite turn
on a length, he stays back to defend
down the wicket, driven to mid-on
leaves the crease again, drives hard, but can't beat short midwicket
pads one away outside off or did he play a shot? The lbw shout is denied
Australia getting sloppy. First India pinch a single to mid-on, and then they take the overthrow too
full, on off, solidly pushed to mid-off
wide length ball, shaping in, Nair gets a stride in and leaves this alone
wide on the crease, angles one in, defended solidly
slower ball, around off, Nair is watchful
leaves a length ball alone outside off
wide on the crease, gets the ball to hold its line, but Nair plays with soft hands, and the thick outside edge goes straight to ground
sharp turn, from short of a length outside off, he goes back to defend
nice turn again, from a length, he goes back to defend
stays back to defend a length-ball offbreak
sharp turn but Nair is outside the line as he defends. Hits the pad but way outside the line
short of a length, but gets good bounce to make sure Nair cannot manoeuvre it for a single
and then he provides him the single. Well played by Nair too, going deep in his crease, letting this bounce, and bunting it towards point for one
short of a length, outside off, guided past gully for one
swing back in, hits Pujara high on the pad, he takes his bottom hand off
tries the bouncer, Pujara stays inside the line. Because the line is outside off, it is easy to avoid
wide length ball, pushed to cover-point
short of a length, wide, cut away, but straight to point
on a length, angling in towards off, Pujara hit high on the bat again
full, outside off, defended to leg
and Nair gets sweeping to try to disturn Lyon, who just about seems to be getting into rhythm. A top edge but safe, gets a couple
nicely played, gets the front foot across, lets the ball turn, and then guides it past short leg for a sharp single. Maxwell's speed surprises them, but there is no direct hit
too much turn as Pujara pads this away. Can't give him
Pujara well forward to defend this length ball outside off
a touch too full, driven to extra cover
leaves alone a length ball outside off
full, just outside off, solidly defended
bouncer, at hisb head, on off and middle, and Nair gets under it

bowled him. That is a beauty from Hazlewood. They needed something special to get a wicket, and Hazlewood has produced it. Sharp reverse swing back in from a length outside off, goes past the inside edge, grazes the pad, and knocks over the off stump. Australia needed a breakthrough there. The fact that this is the first ball that has gone in a while means Nair is caught by surprise by that movement
length ball, swings too far down the leg side. Wade makes the save
full and swinging back in, Ashwin keeps it out
pads one outside leg
outside leg, and kicked away again
padded away again
closer to leg, and Pujara stretches forward to defend
padded away again, but this has turned a long way. Might plant some doubts in his mind
full outside leg, and kicked away
length ball, outside off, Ashwin steers this to third man for a single to get off the mark
full, outside off, hit straight to mid-off, and they want a single. Sent back just in time
good shot, driven wide of mid-off, and gets a single
on a length, angling in, there is half an appeal for pad first but that's all it is. Not given and no reviews. It's bat hitting pad, and not ball hitting pad
loose drive from Ashwin to a wide full ball. The inside edge goes to mid-on
straight length ball that stays low but Ashwin's bat comes down in time
pads away the first ball
and he kicks away another delivery
this one turns less than expected and Wade has to collect down the leg side
full, just outside leg, Pujara uses just his pad
full, on leg, clipped to midwicket
tossed up outside leg, he kicks it away after stretching a long way
full, tailing back in, driven down to mid-off
there it is, the short ball, cuts back in, hits the inner half of the bat as he looks to punch at it
short of a length, angling in, again hits the inner half of the bat
bouncer, and he fends, but he takes the bottom hand off and does well to keep it down
wide on the crease, angles in a quick short ball. Defended well from the crease
short of a length, no room, watchfully defended. Successive maidens for Australia
full outside leg, padded away
another ball kicked away
again another delivery padded away
and Pujara waits and waits, and when the loose ball arrives he dispatches it. Low full toss, he opens the front leg, and drives it past midwicket
closer to leg this time, and he defends this back to him
half an appeal for lbw but O'Keefe knows he has been pitching outside leg so he aborts it
on a length, angling in, pushed to cover-point's right, but Ashwin and Pujara are not the ones for quick singles
short of a length, angling in, Ashwin defends off the back foot
wide length ball, luring Ashwin into a loose push, but he manages to middle it even though he is not close to the ball
short of a length, doesn't rise too high, and he defends this comfortable

drops a bat-pad catch off his own bowling?. Reverse swing, Ashwin plays a loose drive, gets an inside edge onto his pad, the ball lobs up towards the non-striker. Cummins changes his direction in his follow-through, and flies to his right. He gets a hand to it, but with so momentum acting against him, it is really difficult to make it stick
more reverse swing and a shout for lbw but it has swung too much and is headed down
closer to leg, makes him play, and turns it past the bat. So close to that edge
and slightly outside leg now, and Pujara pads it away
on leg now, and Pujara defends off the front foot
on a length, pitches leg, turns to off, defended
as O'Keefe goes outside leg, Pujara kicks it away
full, on leg, defended back to him
low full toss as he looks for the yorker. Ashwin gets the bat down in time
wide sucker ball, Ashwin goes after it, but shanks it to mid-off
good drive on the up, Maxwell puts in a dive at cover, but they get a couple

they are appealing for a glove, and they review it after it has not been given. Brute of a bouncer. Right at his head, Ashwin looks to sway out of its line and throws his hands in front of his face. And it takes the glove as it passes the hand. What amazing bowling this is. This has to be reversed. A nasty bouncer. Ashwin is not happy, but if he watches the replays in the dressing room, he will see the evidence
on a length, outside off, he defends off the front foot
full outside off, driven, but straight to Maxwell at cover-point
and Pujara kicks away another delivery outside leg
padded away again
pads up again to one pitched outside leg. Australia shout but I don't know what for
middle and off now, and he defends it
full, on pads, defended
short of a length, punched straight to mid-off, and Australia now have a new batsman at the business end
on a length, angling in, hits him high on the bat as he defends
brutish, quick, into the rib, 140ks, gets him on the body
wide length ball, Saha doesn't go after it
short, down the the leg side, he avoids it, Wade gets a hand to it, but this bye takes Pujara away from O'Keefe
short, into the body, Pujara ducks it
wide length ball, left alone
on a length, middle and leg, defended back to him
and Saha sweeps immediately. He is going to force change of plan. Swept away square for a four
flat, turns away from just outside off, defended off the back foot
tossed up outside off, pushed to cover
angles this in to middle and leg, defended back to him
on a length, middle and leg, solid front-foot defensive
short of a length, stays low, hits the inside half of the bat
on a length, just outside off, defended off the front foot
length ball, tailing in, clipped to short midwicket
offcutter, too short, Pujara still alert to loose balls, and he goes back to cut this in front of point. He might not be able to manufacture shots, but the bad balls are not going past him
another lovely shot. Gets the width on a shortish ball, gets off his feet and punches it in front of deep point for two
yorker, outside off, dug out by Pujara
Saha putting Australia off their rhythm again. Down the wicket, reaches the pitch of the ball, and lofts O'Keefe over mid-on
drift in, middle and leg, defended back to him
flat length ball outside off, left alone
on a length, on off, and Saha defends this well in front
wide on the crease, flat, on off, defended
tossed up outside off, left alone
wide length ball, left alone
wide length ball again, another leave
slower ball, on a length, wide outside off, left alone, and bounces in front of Wade
wide length ball, and Pujara doesn't go for him
full, outside off, driven to mid-off
defends a length ball solidly
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
full, outside off, driven to long-off. Now Australia's plan will be back on
tossed up outside off, left alone
flat, fired in, Pujara defends off the back foot
left alone outside off as O'Keefe stays quick
and Pujara takes the single successfully off the last ball. Full, on the pads, helped away wide of midwicket. Australia will be frustrated with this, but well played Pujara
length ball, outside off, defended with an open face
wide length ball, and Pujara leaves another delivery alone
slower ball, full outside off, driven to sweeper cover for one
short of a length, nips back in, hits the thigh pad
slower ball, outside off, driven to short cover
good bouncer, just outside off, Saha does well to duck it
wide on the crease, angled in, pushed to mid-on
is that dropped? No it isn't. Shortish delivery, turns a little, beats his cut. No edge
solid front-foot defensive
flat from wide on the crease, defended just outside off
full, on off, tries the bluff, but he drives this straight to mid-off
fired outside leg, Pujara lets it hit his pads
runs this off the outside half of the bat for a sigle to third man
reversing, full, driven to mid-off
nicely played. Slower ball, he lets it come on, and threads the gap between short midwicket and forward square leg
short ball, doesn't get up, pulled away to deep square leg for one
wide on the crease, pitches the ball up, driven to mid-off
wide on the crease, gets the ball to hold its line, Saha plays with soft hands, gets a single to point
short of a length, sits in the surface, punched to long-off for one. Deficit under 100 now
flat, middle and off, worked to leg for one
nice drift and a little turn, defended off the outer half of the bat
full, quicker, defended again off the front foot
nice dip, gets it to turn, but not past his bat
Saha kicks one away as we near the end of the day's play
full, holds its line around off, solid defence from Pujara
full, angling in, punched to mid-on
good bouncer. At the stumps. Pujara watches it early and reacts to duck out of its way
on a length, on off, solid defensive shot
gets the loose ball, clips it away for a single off the pads
gets one to kick off a length, Saha takes the bottom hand off, manages to place it past cover, takes a single
and he fires own down the leg side, and Saha gets some bat on the fine sweep
full, on off, solid front-foot defensive
left alone outside off, no turn, but not close enough to threaten his stumps
defends one right of point for a single
wide on the crease, on off, defended off the front foot
kicks away one tossed up well outside off
full, just outside off, defended to mid-on
full, swinging in, pushed to mid-off
bounder, middle and leg, Saha ducks, Hazlewood stares
swinging in, defended in front of middle and leg
short of a length, middle and off, Saha solid behind it
Saha is rock solid, and India maintain some parity through this partnership
Pujara down the wicket, pushes to mid-off, pushes himself, dives in, and takes the single
slow in the air, on middle and leg, goes with the angle, hits the inside edge and the pad, but there is no silly point
solid front-foot defensive as O'Keefe keeps pitching up
soft outside edge as Saha pushes in front of his body. Gets a single past slip
nicely tossed up, slightly expansive drive from Pujara, manages to keep it down, sending it to short cover
flighted outside off, defended with an open face

given on the field but Saha reviews it. Cummins bowls on a length, gets shape back in, Saha hits his pad with his bat, and there is no bat involved. It has swung too much, and is missing the leg stump. Saha continues to bat
and then he drives the next ball for four. Cummins goes full, searching for swing, but he gives Saha the width, and he drives it in front of point for four
full again, driven hard to mid-off
swings in this time, defended to midwicket
bouncer, at the stumps, Saha sees it early and ducks it
short of a length, outside off, runs this down to third man. Saha is hurting Australia here
full, middle and leg, really slow, turns a little, hits the leading edge, but Pujara's soft hands mean this doesn't go anywhere
full, middle and leg again, defended to leg
on off, no turn, hits his inside edge, but it dies in front of short leg
full again, middle and leg again, Pujara defends to leg
nice loopy delivery, gets some turn, makes him abort any aggressive intent he had in mind
full, middle and off, slight turn, draws another defensive from Pujara
short of a length, outside off, defended to short cover

Cummins has bowled a short one, and has Wade dropped it? This one moves back in, between the bat and the stumps, might have got a feather, but doesn't matter because Wade hasn't caught it clean. Ultra Edge confirms no edge on it
on a length, now, pushed uppishly towards short cover
well done by Lyon. Keeps him on strike. Saha looks to steer this length ball to third man. Lyon is at forward point, runs to his left, puts a desperate dive in, and saves one run
on a length, too straight, tucked away for a single
full, gets it to shape away, but it runs off the outside edge for a single to third man
full, on off, Pujara defends off the front foot
lovely shot. This is only slightly short of a length, but Pujara rocks back early and pulls this between midwicket and mid-on. Good feet and bottom hand there
and solid front-foot defensive now
Pujara presses forward, sees a flatter ball, rocks back, punches it past short cover for one
tossed up, looks to run this past point, but can't beat that man
flighted, overpitched, driven back to the bowler
bouncer, but down the leg side, Wade has to dive to his left to prevent byes
short of a length, outside off, punched hard to deep point
short of a length, doesn't rise too high, hits the lower third of the bat as Saha fends
on a length, on off, defended from the crease
gives him the width on a short ball, punched to square third man for one
short of a length, looks like an offcutter, defended by Pujara from the crease
full, middle and off, defended
flat, into the pads, turned away past short leg. That's 50 for this partnership. Invaluable runs. They shake hands
fired in outside leg, the ball doesn't turn, goes past the pad, Wade gets some body behind it
full and quick, defended back to him
turn from outside leg, he kicks this one away, literally, with his front foot in the air
again, outside his pad, and Wade has to collect this
short of a length, outside off, hits the bottom edge as he looks to steer this
fuller, shaping in, Saha gets the front foot out of the way and defends in front of his body
full again, holds its line just outside off, and Saha defends with an open face again
short of a length, outside off, pushed to point
swinging in, but there is some width, and he guides this past point for another single
short, wide, cut away to square third man for a single
full, just outside leg, defended back
flighted outside leg, padded away
misses his length, Pujara goes back, works this to leg for a single
drifting in, no turn, hits the pad, but takes a healthy inside edge
tossed up outside off, defended to point with an open face
loose ball. To short, on the pads, worked away for a couple. Deficit under 70 now
short of a length, outside off, looks to cut, gets a bottom edge, which goes fine of square third man for a couple
short of a length, straight, low bounce, defended to leg
full, outside off, driven with an open face to point

uncharacteristic hook shot from Pujara. This is a really good bouncer, keeps going at his head, and beats the top edge. Half a shout from Australia, Gaffaney is raising his finger, and then goes on to scratch his head. Looks like he wants to give him out and then withdraws looking at the feeble appeal
short of a length, wide, pushed to point
on a length, straight, defended to mid-on
full, pushed to short cover
driven to short cover again
beats the short cover to his right, takes a single to long-off
and kicked away from outside leg
short of a length, outside leg, Pujara goes back to work this to leg for one
draws the edge. Turn and bounce from a length, hits the shoulder of the bat, and lobs towards point instead of going to slip
bouncer, on off, Pujara ducks it this time
short of a length, punched to the left of cover, and they take a single
too straight, clipped away off the pad
length ball, outside off, defended with an open face
bouncer, just outside off, and he ducks under it
digs this in short, rising towards the throat, and Saha rises to keep it down
on a length, on off, defended off the front foot
length ball, middle and leg, defended back again
smothers the turn on this outside off
no turn, hits the inside half of the bat
looks to pad one away outside off. The ball straightens to settle in Wade's gloves
right forward to defend and end a maiden
short of a length, outside off, steered past the diving Maxwell at point
on a length, on off, defended back to him
nice shot. wide length ball, driven in front of point for two
bouncer, on off, ducks under it
short of a length, angling away, for a second it seems Pujara might follow it, but stays inside the line
bouncer, middle and leg, and he ducks under it. Some words exchanged now
but with wickets, you risk runs. Lyon pitches this slightly short, and Saha goes back to punch it wide of mid-off for two
quick, middle and leg, defended to short leg
full, middle and off, defended off the outer half of the bat
short of a length, Saha goes back to punch this to deep midwicket for one
misfielded by Maxwell at short midwicket, but they don't risk a single
down the wicket to clip this to deep midwicket
bouncer, at leg, Pujara ducks it
bouncer again, Pujara ducks inside it again
slower off cutter, on a length, on off, defended solidly off the front foot
another bouncer, not too high, but Pujara ducks it
bouncer, outside leg, easily ducked again
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease. Maiden over
flat, on a length, slight turn, defended off the back foot with an open face
full, not turn, hits the outside half of the bat as he defends
short of a length, turning down, worked fine of short fine for a single
Pujara presses forward, sees a flat delivery early, goes back in his crease, and whips this away for a single to leg
big appeal for lbw but this has pitched middle and is turning down. No review from Australia
flat, on a length, he goes deep in his crease to defend
bouncer, off and middle, and he ducks it again
short of a length, into the body, defended to leg
slower bouncer, loopy bounce, and Pujara ducks it
slower short ball, Pujara watches it closely, and bunts it into the leg side for a single. That is 400 for India
good sharp short ball. Extra effort. Rises towards the chest. Saha gets the bottom hand off, and rides the bounce to keep this down
bowls the length ball to follow the bouncer with. Saha not quite forward, but the edge is thick and goes square for a single
full, quick, outside off, defended to point
this time he defends it to the right of point for a single that brings the deficit under 50
full, middle and leg, defended past short leg
tossed up on off, slight turn back in, defended back to him
stays quick again, middle and leg, slight turn, defended to short leg
no turn, flighted outside off, goes off the outside half of the bat for s single that brings up Pujara's fifth score of 150 or more. Big applause from the balcony
full, on off, defended to cover
drift in, middle and leg, defended to short leg
flatter, middle and leg, punched to mid-on
slight drift in, Pujara right forward to defend, is hit on the inner half of the bat
tossed up outside off, kicked away

Wade's pad has saved Pujara. dip, turn, takes the edge on the forward defensive. It seems to be going to Smith at slip, but Wade's pad comes in the way and ricochets it past him. Wouldn't have carried to Smith anyway
down the wicket, soft hands, pushes this wide of mid-off, takes a single
down the wicket, the ball doesn't turn, but he covers it with his hands, and even gets a single to cover
down the wicket again, defended to mid-on
reaches this on the half-volley and flicks it to deep midwicket for one
down the wicket, Lyon slows it down, and he defends it
nice dip, slight turn back, defended back to him
wide on the crease, middle and leg, defended off the front foot
quick, no turn, hits the inside half of the bat
tossed up outside off, left alone by Pujara
drops the length, and Pujara quick to go back and pull it to deep square leg for a couple
sharp turn from just outside off. Pujara doesn't follow it with his hands
full, angling in, no turn, hits the inside half of the bat
and Saha shifts gear suddenly. Down the wicket, not to the pitch of the ball, goes with the spin, and lofts this over midwicket for a six. India feeling it now
sweeps this length ball fine, gets a single to fine leg
middle and leg, turns into the pads
nice turn from around off, beats the inside edge, draws a big lbw shout, but it is turning too far down leg
beats him in the flight as Pujara looks to press forward, but he manages to get this to the right of short leg
turn from outside off, but it is slow turn, and Pujara drops this into the covers for a single
short of a length, into the pads, worked to backward square leg
full, outside off, Saha right forward in defence
full, outside off, and a special special fifty for Saha. He has been India's quiet rescue man this season. They owe the Kolkata Test win to him
flat, angling in, no turn, hits the inner half of the bat
short of a length, punched to mid-on
full, flat, Pujara right forward in defence
on a length, slower in the air, middle and off, defended off the front foot
nice little paddle sweep, from in front of the stumps
short of a length, punched into the shin of short leg

lbw appeal, and he has been given. Pujara doesn't react as if he has got an edge, but he reviews it because he think it is turning too much. Pitches on off, turns too much, hits him on leg, and is turning down. Ian Gould will have to reverse his decision. Lyon's wait for a wicket since day one of Bangalore continues
short of a length, middle and leg, punched to deep midwicket
Smith starts moving anticipating a paddle sweep, but Lyon pitches short of a length, and this is defended back
fired into the pads, worked away for an easy single. Deficit under 30
tossed up outside off, defended off the front foot
has he dropped this?. Saha goes back to cut, and is beaten by the extra bounce. The edge is dropped by Wade, who apologises to O'Keefe
defended to cover
driven down to long-off for one
some drift, on a length, into the pads, worked away for a single around the corner
flat, outside off, runs this down to point for a single. O'Keefe rips a half-volley throw at Wade. This can hurt, but not as much as that dropped catch
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, uppishly played wide of short midwicket
on a length, middle and leg, defended to short midwicket
on a length, on off, comes back in, defended back to him
jumps out of the crease again, works this to leg, but straight to square leg
nice dip on this, Pujara defends in front of his body, but manages to make it bounce in front of short leg
back of the bat. Looks for the paddle, the ball stops, turns, takes the edge, hits his forearm, and flies wide of slip
defended to mid-off
flat, middle and leg, defended off the back foot
nice turn from around off, hits the outside edge, but goes wide of slip
defends this in front of his body, the ball goes to point
tossed up on off, solidly defended to end the maiden
on a length, middle and leg, defended to short leg
short of a length, on the pads, worked away to long leg
turn and bounce, but he rides it, drops his wrists, works this to behind square, brings up the hundred for the partnership
flat, on off, holds its line, defended back to him
some dip, Pujara defends off the front foot
short of a length, turning in, punched to mid-off
short of a length, into the pads, and worked around the corner
on a length, outside off, turns away, defended off the front foot
full and straight, defended back to him
overpitched, driven past point for one
short of a length, stays low, but Saha keeps this out. Hit a crack there
too full, and driven to deep cover
short of a length, goes back, punches this to deep cover. The deficit under 20
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
short of a length, pushed to leg, Maxwell looks to dive to his right but doesn't field cleanly
sharp turn from outside off, and Saha gets across and lets it hit him in his chest

shout for a catch as Saha sweeps. Smith reviews reluctantly after Gould refuses to give this. Saha is beaten by the bounce, and and the ball is clear of the bat and the glove. The sound comes from bat hitting the ground. Australia lose a review. Frustration beginning to show now
on a length, turning in, defended from the crease
swing first up, Pujara plays with soft hands as this length ball bounces at him. He has managed to place this wide of point for a single

some outswing, but Saha stays beside the line, and drives this. Less feet, more hands. Places this between point and cover. This is a good ball, but Saha is well in and has hit him for an undeserved boundary
and he tries the big inswinger this time. Defended to leg. Saha equal to it
short of a length, good bounce into the ribs, defended by Saha
short of a length, just outside off, defended off the toes
lovely ball to end the over. On a length, just outside off, Saha defends the angle, but the ball holds its line to beat the edge. Good carry too. Nearly bursts out of Wade's gloves
on a length, outside off, holds its line. Left alone
on a length, angling in towards off, defended to mid-on
beauty. Too good to take the edge. Pitches this up, just outside off, and swings late to beat the bat as Pujara defends the angle

beautiful from Pujara. This is why it is so difficult to bowl to Pujara. Hazlewood misses the edge last ball, and goes fuller still to perhaps take the edge. Pujara, though, is on it like a hawk and whips it through midwicket. Need I add that this is hit along the ground again
pulls the length back, and draws a forward defensive. India trail by one seven
outswinger, Pujara gets a stride in to drive, but straight to short cover
gorgeous. India driving it in now. On a length, outside off, Saha extends his arms, places this between short cover and mid-off. Phew, what a shot
short of a length, straight, defended back to him
sharp bouncer from wide on the crease, and a lovely leave from Saha. He breaks his back leg, moves his head out of its line, and drops the bat under it
another amazing delivery, but he just can't hit the edge here. Short of a length, holds its line outside off, Saha pushes at it but doesn't edge. Wade collects it head high
short of a length, defended off the front foot
loose shot is drawn through the raw pace earlier in the over. Short of a length but not short enough to cut. Saha just pushes at it with a horizontal bat. Lucky not to edge it
bouncer, middle and leg, he ducks it, and the ball flies through to Wade
short of a length, seam back in, hits him high on the bat
and the moment Hazlewood strays a little, he has been picked away for a single to deep square leg
length ball, outside off, steered to third man for a single
bouncer, middle and leg, angles down, ducked easily
on a length, outside off, defended off the front foot
seams back in from short of a length, but Saha gets an inside edge onto the pad
and India draw level as Saha steers this shortish ball to square third man
and India in the lead as Pujara tucks this away off the hip
short of a length, outside off, defended by Saha
bouncer, middle and leg, this one doesn't come up as much as expected, but Saha is down on his knee, and still manages to keep his bat and gloves down
full, on off, defended to mid-off
on a length, middle and leg, defended
looks to defend outside off, no turn, Pujara is hit on the pad, but he is outside the line
full, on off, and now they get a single off the soft outside edge
slight shimmy, beaten in the air, defended to cover
too full, pushed to short cover
full, just outside off, defended back to O'Keefe
short of a length, extra bounce, but Pujara rides it and steers it to third man for one
wide on the crease, angles one in, defended with an open face
bouncer from wide on the crease, but no pace in the pitch now, and Pujara easily gets out of its line
hits the handle of the bat now with a short ball, but it doesn't lob up. Cummins must be thinking there is no justice in this world
wide on the crease, angles this short ball down the leg side. Wade collects
goes for the fuller one after short balls. He would have hoped Pujara's weight will be back, but he is right forward in defending this one. Really heart-breaking for a bowler
lovely shot, down the wicket to drive this to deep cover
down the wicket, the ball doesn't turn, and he defends this to leg
flatter, shorter, defended to leg
down the wicket, and he invariably keeps missing the midwicket fielder with this. Takes a single
full, outside off, pushed to cover
flat, quick, Saha goes deep into his crease to defend
on a length, hits him high on the bat as Pujara defends
length ball, on the pads, clipped away to deep square leg for one
swinging in, driven back to Hazlewood
on a length, on off, holds its line a little, defended
short of a length, optimistic shout for lbw as he jumps inside the line and is hit on thigh pad
bouncer, middle and off, Saha ducks it again n
flighted outside leg, padded away
closer to leg, and Pujara plays the forward defensive
too full, and Pujara digs it out for a single. This is now the highest seventh-wicket partnership for India against Australia
Saha won't pad these away. He jumps out, swings against the rough, in the air, but misses short midwicket
and Saha running with his luck now. Beaten in the flight as he jumps out of his crease, and the ball turns to take the edge, but it clears mid-off. Warner puts in the big chase and saves one run
and Pujara pads one away to end the over
grubber now. Short of a length, outside off, and it squeezes under Saha's bat
on a length, pretty straight, defended to short midwicket
on a length, on off, defended from the crease
solid front-foot defensive to a length ball
wide on the crease, gets it to holds its line, hits the outside half of the bat on the forward-defensive
too full, push-driven to mid-off. Warner's direct hit nearly concedes an overthrow
outside leg again, and Wade has to do the work
and he drops short to allow them a single
bowled flat and quick, defended from the crease
looks for the paddle sweep to one outside leg. Misses
front-foot defensive to a slower higher delivery
and a forward defensive again to end the over
short of a length, on off, punched back to Hazlewood

edged down the leg side but wide enough of Wade who flies to his left. This is a touch too straight, and even though this has hurried him, Pujara gets enough bat. Actually he gets an inside edge that is headed to the keeper, but the deflection off the thigh pad takes it wide
into the top-five longest innings for India. Pushed to mid-off
bouncer, on off, Pujara ducks it
big big shout for a catch off the inside edge. Not given, and Australia don't review it. This one nips back in, goes past the inside edge, and hits him high on the back pad. Great take by Wade
short of a length, straight, defended to leg
flighted outside leg, pushed to mid-on
outside leg, lets it hit his pad
stays back to defend a length ball
he sweeps fine but can't beat short fine leg
full, outside leg, pushed back to O'Keefe
quicker, flatter, on middle and off, punched to cover-point
on a length, straight, worked to deep square leg for India. Fourth-longest innings by an Indian batsman, and longest in India
late inswing, but Saha's bat comes down in front of his pad and does so in time
short of a length, straight, defended to cover
swing in again, middle and leg, defended to leg
bouncer, Saha looks to ramp, but the ball doesn't come on, and he ends up top-edging it, but the third man is too square for this
inswinger, beats his defence, but his the pad high, and draws only half a shout
padded away as O'Keefe stays outside leg
outside leg again, and left alone
short of a length, punched to square leg
and kicks one away again
this forward-defensive makes this the third-longest innings by an Indian
pads one away to end a maiden
nearly there. Length ball, stops at him, turned to leg, but doesn't carry to short midwicket and also goes for two runs
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point
on a length, straight, defended to mid-on
bouncer, Pujara under it and sways out of its line
length ball, angling in, worked away to leg
length ball, holds its line, defended off the front foot
padded away outside leg again
and he kicks away another
flatter, and Pujara goes back immediately to look for a single to leg. Can't place it
flighted outside leg, and kicked away again
this time he finds the gap with the short ball and takes a single to deep midwicket
short of a length, outside leg, placed in front of short fine leg for a single
bouncer again. This is a big effort from Cummins. Keeping the runs down
another bouncer, into the body, and he ducks it
and another bouncer. These are not to high so he can keep going. Saha ducks it
short of a length, into the ribs, hits the bat hard. Defended to short leg. His bottom hand comes off the bat

hits him on the chest as Saha looks to move outside the line of it. Desperate review taken by Smith. Saha does really well to drop his wrists out of the way, and lets it hit him in the chest. Lobs to Smith at slip, and he wastes the review
yorker to end the over. Another maiden
full, outside leg, pushed wide of O'Keefe for a single
down the wicket, beaten in the flight, defends to short cover
looks to sweep, the bottom edge goes wide of short fine leg, they get a single, and then an overthrow from Wade who backflicks this nowhere
full, outside leg, defended off the high part of the bat
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
flat, outside leg, defended by Pujara
bouncer again, Cummins giving the umpires every chance to ask for the light metres
bouncer, into the body, he gets under it
bouncer into his body again, and Saha ducks it again
the odd length ball to change things up. Hit off the inside half of the bat to mid-on
short of a length, just outside off, defended to point
short of a length, outside off, steered to third man for one
gets a single to the right of short fine leg
full, outside leg, kicked away
middle and leg now, and Pujara defends
the second-longest innings by an Indian as he defends one outside leg
flat, stays low outside leg, pushed back to O'Keefe
middle and off, and defended to cover
full, middle and leg, driven back to him
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
sweeps, gets an edge, it goes wide of leg slip, and gets them a couple
short of a length, goes back, works this around the corner
on a length, lets it turn, works this to leg, takes a single. This is the joint-longest innings by an Indian batsman. So he will surely break the record unless he is run out when not facing
on a length, middle and leg, and he defends from the crease
full, on leg, defended solidly. Longest innings by an Indian now
full, outside leg, turned around the corner for one
full, flat, on leg, defended off the front foot
another defensive shot after shaping up for the sweep
misfielded by Lyon at cover. The hard work is showing in the legs. Lyon doesn't bend enough and concedes two runs
swept, but straight to short fine leg
down the wicket, pushes this wide of mid-on
down he wicket, lovely shot, over mid-off, gets four runs for it
tossed up on off, defended off the front foot
driven to long-on for one
length ball, outside off, turning in, defended to leg
flat, on off, turning in, another defensive
short of a length, outside leg, worked to square leg for a single
and now India are picking singles at will. Pujara drops one length ball towards point and rushes through
solid front-foot defensive now
angled in from wide on the crease, defended solidly again
on a length, on off, defended off the back foot
beaten on the outside edge. Extra bounce on a length ball, and beats his attempt to late-cut him
short of a length, into the pads, whipped away to long leg
tossed up outside off, defended solidly off the front foot
another misfield, this time by Smith at midwicket. Wheels coming off, just about. Saha reaches 99
flat length ball, punched to short midwicket
inside edge as this is a rare mental error from Pujara looking to whip a length ball to leg
tossed up outside off, looks to defend, is hit on the pad, but outside the line of off
and there he gets the hundred. With a single to square leg. The whole dressing room erupts. Saha has rescued India yet again
full, middle and leg, defended
short of a length, middle and leg, punched to midwicket
into the pads, defended around the corner
flat, middle and leg, angling towards off, punched to mid-on
whipped away off the pads for one
down the wicket, reaches the pitch of the ball, drives it to midwicket
flighted outside off, defended with an open face
pulled in the air. That is the only time he plays the ball off the ground. Clears midwicket. He rushes to the back foot early and beats the man at midwicket
on a length, no turn, hits the inside half of the bat
on a length again, angling in, worked past short leg for one
full, outside off, driven in front of deep cover, and they come back for two now
short of a length, on the pads, whipped to deep square leg
short of a length, worked away to long leg
down the wicket, and he beats short midwicket, as he invariably does

Looking to punch a short ball away, but the ball stops on him and is chipped to short midwicket. What a great innings. Everybody applauds him. All the Aussies too. Great great display of discipline and mental strength
defends a length ball
drifting in, turning towards off, defended off the outside half for a single

outside leg again, defended back to him

drives a full ball to long-off

goes deep into the crease and bunts this shortish delivery for one
short of a length, on off, punched to deep point
wide length ball, loose defensive shot outside off. Doesn't edge it, though

dropped at mid-on. Would have been a sensational catch for someone who has bowled 71 overs. Umesh slogs, lobs one straight of mid0on, O'Keefe flies, gets a hand to it, but it pops out on impact as he comes down
straight, on off, defended off the back foot
slower ball, Jadeja swings, and he misses. Hazlewood unlucky he misses the off stump

down the wicket, drives this wide of mid-off, gets a single

Jadeja rubs it in with a skip down the wicket to loft him into the sight screen
full, middle and leg, defended to leg

big drive, gets a thick inside edge, and comes back for a second
spin from outside off, but Jadeja gets outside the line as it turns past the inside edge

lovely clean hit. Down the wicket, not to its pitch, which is good because he can now swing his arms, and then sends him into the sight screen again

this is going to hurt Cummins. Slower offcutter, Umesh pushes at it, and the thick edge rolls along for four. Fifty for this partnership too
goes for the yorker, but Umesh's bat comes down in time
bouncer, and Umesh brings up his bat horizontally in self defence. Gets a single to deep square leg
slow, on a length, on off, defended off the front foot

Ishant will come out to bat now. Umesh jumps out of the crease, looking to clear mid-off, but gets too close to the ball  and slices it low to mid-off. O'Keefe has a third wicket for one short of 200 runs

tucked away off the hip, to the left of square leg, gets to the other end

stabs at a wide length ball, gets a thick outside edge, gets four past the slips
nasty. Marsh is looking to leave alone one short ball outside off, but it hits the pitch and jags back in to hit him in the rib cage

Smith pads up to one outside leg, but it spins past the pad to flatten the off stump. This is an inverted replay of what Jadeja did to Smith four years ago in Delhi. Bowled when shouldering alone. So what has Smith done wrong here? This is outside leg, so it is okay to pad it away, but it is slightly half-committed padding. Doesn't cover the line enough, leaving the ball a chance to spin past the pad. Pujara used to stride forward when padding up. Smith has only half a forward movement. And Jadeja rips it from the rough. This could be over for Australia

another forward-defensive
